description: [Status: stable] [Name: django-exclude-with-model-form] [Message: Do not use exclude with ModelForm, use fields instead] What it does Checks for the use of exclude in Django ModelForm classes. Why is this bad? If a ModelForm includes the exclude attribute, any new field that is added to the model will automatically be exposed for modification. Example from django.forms import ModelForm class PostForm(ModelForm): class Meta: model = Post exclude = ["author"] Use instead: from django.forms import ModelForm class PostForm(ModelForm): class Meta: model = Post fields = ["title", "content"]
